page.title: 09M.O.D.SITE
page.content: In 1938,as Europe prepared for war, the strategic importance of sites to the N.W. of London became obvious - in that they were less vulnerable to air attack.Harefield House was one such site and here was established the Test House for the Aeronautical Inspection Directorate: this was later to be known as the A.Q.D. The work done here for the last 48 years has been concerned with the maintenance of the highest possible standards of quality assurance connected with military aircraft procurement. All Q.A.Directorates have been amalgamated under the Director General of Defence Quality Assurance and the Harefield site is due for closure.This represents yet another loss of local employment opportunity within this rural area.
